column4: I am trying to create a launcher for a python program but I can't figure it out. Here is the command I am using in the launcher. "/home/angel/.config/pystromo/pystromo-remap.py -m default.map" Can someone tell me what I am doing wrong?
does your program need a terminal?
I normally start it from terminal but I don't believe it requires one.
I mean, is the output of the program in the terminal or do you get a new window?
it's a background program. When I run it from terminal I get output in the terminal window but no new window is created.
then, in the launcher choose "type: application in terminal" in the drop down menu
trying that now.
and the command should be "/home/angel/.config/pystromo/pystromo-remap.py -m default.map"
or maybe "python /home/angel/.config/pystromo/pystromo-remap.py -m default.map"
ok trying them now. Getting an error with the first, but the error pertains to a problem with pystromo I need to fix. Not with the launcher. Will let you know as soon as I figure this part out

This "/home/angel/.config/pystromo/pystromo-remap.py -m /home/angel/.config/pystromo/default.map" Did the trick, with the run in terminal turned out. Thanks for your help. Question though, I would like to turn this into a startup program. There is not an option when creating a startup program to run it in terminal. Might you have any suggestions as to what command I should use to get it to work from startup?
go to System-> Preferences-> Startup applications
I am already there, just trying to work out the kinks of the command for the startup addition.
try with "gnome-terminal -x /home/angel/.config/pystromo/pystromo-remap.py -m default.map"
what is the -x for>
means to execute the remainder of the command within the gnome-terminal
but b/c you're using gnome-terminal, I'm not sure how it will work
ZykoticK9, ok I am going to go mess with all this information you gave me. thanks a lot for your help guys! :)
maybe you want to install roxterm.  I love it.  Like gnome-terminal but lighter
I will check into it

This "xterm -e(or -x) /home/angel/.config/pystromo/pystromo-remap.py -m /home/angel/.config/pystromo/default.map" worked great. It started up the program like it was supposed to. Now I am just trying to clean up. On the boot it starts the program in an xterm that is visible and won't close. I would like it to run the command in a terminal that doesn't show up. I want it to run in the background basically. Do you have any suggestions?
